title: Citi Kazakhstan Supports Junior Achievement
summary: Citi Kazakhstan has supported Junior Achievement (JA) since 2002, a world leader of economic education for young people, operating in 112 countries around the globe. JA Kazakhstan has achieved tremendous results in creating opportunities for affordable, high-quality business and economic education for over 215,000 young people in Kazakhstan.
tag-2: Citi Kazakhstan has supported Junior Achievement (JA) since 2002, a world leader of economic education for young people, operating in 112 countries around the globe. JA Kazakhstan has achieved tremendous results in creating opportunities for affordable, high-quality business and economic education for over 215,000 young people in Kazakhstan.
tag-3: Over 600 participants have taken part in the recent JA 'Banks in Action' program and teachers across the country have expressed interest in using the program in teaching their optional and compulsory economic course. Top performing students who participated in the 'Banks in Action' National Tournament gained practical experience during the competition and Tournament winners were awarded with grants to leading Universities in Kazakhsatn such as KBTU and Academy of Labor and Social Relations.
tag-4: As part of the JA 'Banks in Action' program, Junior Achievement and Citi organized a three-day National Training workshop for school teachers of economics from across the country. The Ministry of Education of Kazakhstan supported the workshop. Citi volunteers developed and presented a master-class on banking which included four sessions on the bank's financial performance, Citi's organizational structure, training on compound interest and the borrowing and saving of money. Fifty-six teachers from all regions of Kazakhstan participated in the National Training and had opportunity to gain additional professional knowledge and skills, contributing to the training of staff in schools and colleges across the country.
tag-5: The results of the project were presented in the article "The Educative Project of Junior Achievement Kazakhstan and Citibank Kazakhstan" published by the Ministry of Education and Science of RK on their website, as well as in the journal of the National Teachers Re-training Institutes (2009) and on the Junior Achievement Kazakhstan website in the 'Projects' section.
